Package ePortfolio

Class MutualFund

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Investment
ePortfolio.MutualFund
public class MutualFund extends Investment
The MutualFund class represents a mutual fund investment in the portfolio. It extends the Investment class and includes specific properties and methods related to mutual funds, such as handling redemption fees and calculating gain/loss. This class also provides methods for buying and selling mutual fund investments.

  • Constructor Details

    • MutualFund

      public MutualFund(String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price, double bookValue, double payment, double bookValueSold)
      Constructor to initialize the mutual fund with its properties.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The symbol of the mutual fund.
      name - The name of the mutual fund.
      quantity - The quantity of the mutual fund shares.
      price - The price of the mutual fund share.
      bookValue - The book value of the mutual fund.
      payment - The payment for the mutual fund investment.
      bookValueSold - The value of the mutual fund sold.

  • Method Details

    • calculatePayment

      public double calculatePayment(int quantity, double price)
      Calculates the payment for the mutual fund investment, factoring in the redemption fee.
      Overrides:
      calculatePayment in class Investment
      Parameters:
      quantity - The quantity of the mutual fund shares.
      price - The price of the mutual fund share.
      Returns:
      The calculated payment after redemption fee.

    • calculateGain

      public double calculateGain(double price)
      Calculates the gain or loss for the mutual fund investment. The gain is calculated as the new payment minus the book value.
      Overrides:
      calculateGain in class Investment
      Parameters:
      price - The price of the mutual fund share.
      Returns:
      The calculated gain or loss from the investment.

    • calculateBookValue

      Overrides:

      Parameters:

      price - The price of the mutual fund share.
      Returns:
